chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
All charges against Joshua L Cannon in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua L Cannon is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L Cannon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua L Cannon appeared by video.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in Court for Joshua L Cannon.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense is ready to proceed. State is not ready to proceed. State advised the Court of witness issue. State has no alternative theory of prosecution. Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Dismiss. Court ordered case DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE. Defendant released from all conditions of Bail. Any Bail on deposit to be returned to the person who posted it. Case forwarded to the Clerk's Office for processing.

Defendant Joshua L Cannon appeared by video.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in Court for Joshua L Cannon.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated September 28, 2022; received and filed. "Missed Contact"

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Case adjourned to allow time for Defense to review offer with Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial hearing and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.

Clerk contacted the parties via email to RESCHEDULE Final PreTrial.
NEW DATE: Final PreTrial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Information provided to Victim/Witness Advocate.

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in Court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
Jury Trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in Court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received partial discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested time to review same with Defendant. Court granted request. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next Court date. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Kramschuster. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Joshua L Cannon in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua L Cannon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
